p: The described effects of dsRNA are realized not only in infected cells, but also in cells subjected to malignant transformation. As it has been shown in several mouse and human cell lines, TLR3 agonists inhibit growth of tumor cells through two main mechanisms: suppression of proliferation and induction of apoptotic death [ 45]. In addition, dsRNAs are able to influence immune system cells by inducing antitumor immune responses. Stimulation of antigen-presenting DC by dsRNA leads to activation of NK cells and cytotoxic CD8+ T-lymphocytes causing death of tumor cells [ 47, 48]. Phenotype transformation of myeloid suppressor cells and tumor-associated macrophages, caused by dsRNA, resulted in an increase in their antitumor activity [ 45, 49].
